channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Black Friday faces its ultimate test as desperate retailers and low consumer confidence collide in a high-stakes holiday standoff
item.description: "Consumers feel on edge," says Mastercard chief economist Michelle Meyer.

item.title: Billionaire MacKenzie Scott once needed her college roommate’s help with a $1,000 loan: ‘That’s just what you do for friends’
item.description: Years later, Scott repaid the favor when Jeannie Tarkenton started Funding U, a lending company that offers merit-based loans to low-income students.

item.title: The Louvre will hike prices for everyone who isn’t from Europe—from $25 to $37
item.description: Last year, the Louvre welcomed 8.7 millions visitors. 77% of them were foreigners.

item.title: U.S. stocks lift on the last day of November as Wall Street eagerly awaits the results of Black Friday
item.description: Wall Street is operating on an abbreviated schedule Friday after being closed for the Thanksgiving holiday.

item.title: Trump says he wants to ‘permanently pause migration’ from poor countries: ‘Only reverse migration can fully cure this situation’
item.description: Donald Trump spent part of his Thanksgiving holiday railing against immigrants on social media.

item.title: Alphabet’s stock is the most overbought ever by one measure. Is that a problem?
Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq open higher as stocks head for five-day winning streak
The first worry for stocks Friday morning: an outage at a major exchange
Apple and 9 more tech companies that have treated their shareholders like gold
Is the stock market open today for Black Friday?
